Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2014 06:44PM Lovemyboysandlabs wrote: Thank you so much for replying so quickly. I know I will have support here and that comforts me. I will take the advice and have a fun weekend.
Posts.Title: Radiologist said I likely have cancer Lovemyboysandlabs ziggypop

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2014 05:18PM Lovemyboysandlabs wrote: Thanks momof3greatkids. that is what i worry about most--not me and what I am going through but what my kids will go through. I am very scared because of the way the radiologist was showing me everything and the fact that she said likely its cancer. I am even more scared because I feel that it is worse than just a lump caught early - she showed a few areas of concern, used the word rare at one point and mentioned lymph nodes. Of course all this time I am in a state of shock because I suspect by now it's not a simple cyst, so everything she said is now kind of a blur. I wish someone else was there with me but as I mentioned I thought i was going as just a precaution. I will keep everyone posted.
Posts.Title: Radiologist said I likely have cancer Lovemyboysandlabs ziggypop

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2014 04:35PM Lovemyboysandlabs wrote: This process is a rollercoaster ride that's for sure. I worked today and that thankfully helped me keep my mind busy. My mom has worked in oncology for years and she has listened to me and has answered my questions about all of this, things I can expect if i have it, etc. Her knowledge and these posts are keeping me somewhat sane. My husband is not accepting this just yet-- he won't until this test comes back. He will be strong for me I know but right now I think he believes all will be okay . I thank you all from the bottom of my heart. I don't know any of you at all,  but I feel so comforted by your replies and you are all amazing.
Posts.Title: Radiologist said I likely have cancer Lovemyboysandlabs ziggypop

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2014 04:48AM Lovemyboysandlabs wrote: I am prepared for sure, but what's scary fir me is that my mind goes immediately to the worst case scenario -- you have months to live. I know i shouldnt, but I am sure others went through it too. Nights are really hard I wake up with horrible thoughts. I now just want to know what is going on. I really want to hear some success stories right now. Thank you, this helps a lot!

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2014 07:34PM Lovemyboysandlabs wrote: I am going through it too, so know you aren't alone. I visit my oncologist for the first time tomorrow. I had a Pet scan and MRI, so I am anxious about those results. Hang in there and try to stay away from web searching, whenever I do it only makes things thousands times worse. HUGS TO YOU
Posts.Title: So scared... Lovemysons Beesie

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2014 08:01PM Lovemyboysandlabs wrote: AlienWish, I joined here when I was in the same place you are and it helped me so much. I am 43 and have 2 kids ages 6 and 8, so I know how scared you must be. I have met virtual friends on this site that have been such a support to me during this difficult time. You are not alone. I hope this comes back negative for you.  I had the same thing happen, they told me after my mammogram it was likely cancer and indeed it was, but please know that if that does happen, this is not a death sentence as someone stated above. Trust me you will feel better when you start talking to the doctors and get your treatment plan in place. I have finished my chemo and now facing surgery, so I am about half way through. Stay strong and please stay positive! Let us know what happens and if you need anything at all!
